question: Managing what is in memory and when is the responsibility of the running process
Which of the following is not a factor to consider when deciding which storage medium to use
To prevent a process from running too long the operating system uses a
Main memory is an example of Nonvolatile storage (NVS)
Which of the following is not a service commonly provided by an operating system?
Which of the following is not a component of a process?
options: These are all components of a process
answer: These are all components of a process

question: A context switch consumes CPU time
A parent and child process always share the same block of memory
A parent process must wait for its child processes to finish before it can execute instructions.
If a program declares a variable before a fork() the child and the parent can communicate with one another using that variable.
Which of the following is a reason why two processes may want to cooperate?
When two processes communicate using an unbounded buffer, the producer may need to wait before writing to the buffer.
The greater the serial portion of a task, the greater the expected performance gains by adding parallelism.
Suppose a program can run 10% serial and 90% parallel. Using Amdahl's Law, calculate the expected performance gain by adding 16 cores.
Which of the following is not a benefit of multithreading?
options: CPU instructions execute faster when run in a thread
Applications respond to user input faster
Threads can run on multiple CPUs or multiple cores concurrently
answer: CPU instructions execute faster when run in a thread

question: In a nonpreemptive scheduling scheme, the next process to run is
options: The next process in the queue
The process in the queue with the highest priority
The process in the queue with the shortest run time
answer: The next process in the queue

question: One drawback to Priority scheduling is
options: Longer average waiting time compared to most other scheduling algorithms

question: In Round-Robin CPU scheduling, if there are 10 processes in the ready queue and the time quantum is 3ms, then no process waits more than
In Multilevel queue scheduling, which of the following is not true?
options: Processes can move between the queues
Each queue is assigned a priority level
Different queues can use different scheduling algorithms
answer: Processes can move between the queues

question: To balance tasks across multicores, an operating system may employ which strategy?
options: Periodically check for cores with too many tasks and push some of those tasks to other cores
Periodically check for cores that have too few tasks and pull some tasks from other cores

question: Shared data that is always read-only does not necessarily need to be used in a critical section.
Mutex locks and semaphores are identical concepts. Programmers choose one or the other as a matter of style.

A parent and child process always share the same block of memory

Main memory is an example of Nonvolatile storage (NVS)

A process is by definition a program in execution

The primary purpose of an operating system is:
options: To make the most efficient use of the computer hardware
To allow people to use the computer
To make computers easier to use
answer: To make the most efficient use of the computer hardware

question: The operating system kernel is:
options: The same thing as the CPU
A low-level part of the system that interfaces directly with the hardware
An application like a word processor
answer: A low-level part of the system that interfaces directly with the hardware

question: Interrupts are:
options: Generated by exceptional conditions in the CPU
Signals that inform the OS that an event has occurred
answer: Signals that inform the OS that an event has occurred

question: Message passing is typically faster than shared memory.
Which of the following is a reason why two processes may want to cooperate?
Unlike forking, if the parent thread of a multithreaded process exits, all of its 'child' threads will also exit.
If a process has multiple threads and one of the threads calls fork(), the child process will also be multithreaded.
In a one-to-one multithreading model, the developer can use only single-threading.
Context switching is managed by the
Consider the following processes in the ready queue with the following CPU burst times. Match the following scheduling algorithms with the order of processes
answer: FCFS: P1, P2, P3, SJF: P2, P3, P1, LCFS: P3, P2, P1, RR (Quantum 10): P1, P2, P3, P1

question: In Round-Robin CPU scheduling, if there are 10 processes in the ready queue and the time quantum is 3ms, then no process waits more than
With a Multilevel Feedback Queue scheduling algorithm, once the scheduler has placed the process in a queue, it could be moved to a different queue later.
One drawback to Priority scheduling is
options: Longer average waiting time compared to most other scheduling algorithms

question: To select a process to run in a multiprocessor architecture, the scheduler will assign processes to a core from
options: Either a common or a private ready queue is possible
answer: Either a common or a private ready queue is possible

question: Which of the following is not a necessary criterion for a solution to the critical section problem?
options: All processes with a critical section must employ mutual exclusion
If the shared resource is available for use, any process that wants to use it can secure the resource and enter its critical section
A process may not prevent other processes from ever entering their critical section
All processes that wish to use a shared resource must have an equal chance of obtaining the shared resource
answer: All processes that wish to use a shared resource must have an equal chance of obtaining the shared resource

question: Peterson's solution is a common strategy employed by modern operating systems to solve the critical section problem
A semaphore can be implemented as a mutex lock
A common approach used by most modern operating systems to manage process synchronization is to temporarily disable interrupts
